main event: Multiple sightings of bright lights in the sky over Greensburg, Pennsylvania, between August 11 and August 15, 1965.
interesting points: The objects observed were described as much brighter than Venus, indicating unusual brightness., The witness is a nuclear physicist and a member of the Pittsburgh Astronomical Group, lending credibility to his observations., The sightings occurred repeatedly with similar descriptions of lights moving from east to west., Observations were marked by a gradual fading out of the lights rather than a sudden disappearance., The Air Force's investigation suggested the objects were likely not conventional aircraft based on their behavior and characteristics.
sighted object: bright lights moving in the sky
witness description: Scientists and laypersons, including a nuclear physicist with experience in aviation and astronomy.
